text.div:
ODH ExceptionValueVS ValueSet

Reasons that a value associated with a test or other finding is missing. Includes all codes from http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/data-absent-reason version 3.3.0 and additional codes covering other missing value circumstances.

name: ExceptionValueVS
title: ODH ExceptionValueVS ValueSet
description: Reasons that a value associated with a test or other finding is missing. Includes all codes from 	http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/data-absent-reason version 3.3.0 and additional codes covering other missing value circumstances.

concept.display: Unknown: The value is not known.
Asked But Unknown: The source human does not know the value.
Temporarily Unknown: There is reason to expect (from the workflow) that the value may become known.
Not Asked: The workflow didn't lead to this value being known.
Asked But Declined: The source was asked but declined to answer.
Masked: The information is not available due to security, privacy or related reasons.
Not Applicable: There is no proper value for this element (e.g. last menstrual period for a male)
Unsupported: The source system wasn't capable of supporting this element.
As Text: The content of the data is represented in the resource narrative.
Error: Some system or workflow process error means that the information is not available.
Not a Number (NaN): The numeric value is undefined or unrepresentable due to a floating point processing error.
Negative Infinity (NINF): The numeric value is excessively low and unrepresentable due to a floating point processing error.
Positive Infinity (PINF): The numeric value is excessively high and unrepresentable due to a floating point processing error.
Not Performed: The value is not available because the observation procedure  (test, etc.) was not performed.
Not Permitted: The value is not permitted in this context (e.g. due to profiles, or the base data types)
The value could not be determined or established with accuracy or certainty.
The reason the information is not present is not known.
The answer is appears missing because the correct answer is null or empty; e.g., a question that asks for a list of the names of siblings applied to an only child.
Missing due to a problem collecting, identifying, or locating the specimen, including patient refusal or unable to provide specimen
Missing due to a problem with the specimen, e.g. inadequate specimen, contamination, clotting, improper tube type, improper storage, too small, etc.
Missing due to instrument malfunction.
